name: 1H-pyrazole-5-methanol, 3-methyl-
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3901
Reason: 1H-pyrazole-5-methanol has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for this compound can be 1-methyl-3-nitropropane, which has a melting point around 30 degrees Celsius. The pyrazole ring introduces rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, approximately -5 degrees Celsius. The nitro group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50 degrees Celsius. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, approximately -5 degrees Celsius. The effects are additive.
